other_tests.procedure_name: Genetic analysis of CYP11B1 gene mutations
other_tests.findings: Novel mutations identified: W116C, L299P, and 3-bp deletion /H9004F438, resulting in severe or complete loss of 11-hydroxylase activity.
Typical pattern for congenital adrenal hyperplasia (CAH) due to 11-hydroxylase deficiency observed in multiple patients; elevated levels of 17-hydroxyprogesterone, testosterone, and androstenedione.
Increased ACTH levels in M.M. (494.35 pmol/liter; normal range 2.26–10.64 pmol/liter) and elevated 17-hydroxyprogesterone (8.47 nmol/liter; normal range 0.27–2.33 nmol/liter).
